results.title: ShortDatePattern in ar-SA CultureInfo.DateTimeFormat contains a "g" that cause problems with date-fns format function - Microsoft Q&A
results.description:
I found also this question (closed) that shows the difference between the obtained date and the expected date:
https://social.msdn.microsoft.com/Forums/en-US/3a08ac46-250d-484a-9da6-28f14499a74b/datetime-format-error-at-cultureinfoquotarsaquot?forum=csharplanguage
The answer says that it is using the Hijri calendar but dows not explain why there is that extra "g" in the pattern.
Also "G" (or "GG" and "GGG") are placeholders for the era (AC, BC) but "g" does not exists in hte MS DateTime format explanations.
So, within dotnet 6.0.1 I found 3 cultures with this "g" in theit short date pattern:
ps: g yyyy/M/d
ps-AF: g yyyy/M/d
ar-SA: "d‏/M‏/yyyy g"
When I use this patterns within date-fns.format() (
https://date-fns.org/v2.28.0/docs/format
) it fails with this error:
https://date-fns.org/v2.28.0/docs/format
Also date-fns/locale/ar-SA has these date formats:
full: 'EEEE, MMMM do, y',
long: 'MMMM do, y',
medium: 'MMM d, y',
short: 'MM/dd/yyyy',
The "short" is  "MM/dd/yyyy" not d‏/M‏/yyyy g.
What is the "g" in the date pattern ?
Is the dotnet 6 short date pattern correct for ar-SA, or it should be "MM/dd/yyyy" ?

descriptions.content: I found also this question (closed) that shows the difference between the obtained date and the expected date: https://social.msdn.microsoft.com/Forums/en-US/3a08ac46-250d-484a-9da6-28f14499a74b/datetime-format-error-at-cultureinfoquotarsaquot?
What is the "g" in the date pattern ?

This example uses Date as the input.
